result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward Vieyra

records.addlTxt: case dismissed

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Report has been received; attys stipulate to the report.  Deft concurs with the report.  Court finds the deft is not competent and will not become competent within the time period allowed by law.  DA's office to refer this matter to Corp Counsel.  Deft is discharged from these files and shall be released from custody.
Evaluation on Competency to stand trial

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Atty Cassi Baumgardner appeared on behalf of deft.  No appearance by deft.  Bench warrant authorized; $1,000 cash bond.  Prior bond forfeited.n
from Wis. Forensic Unit - unable to complete report - unable to reach deft
For Competency Exam (Form 205).

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Defense counsel raises issue of competency.  Court reviews competency report from 14CM1901.  Proceedings are suspended and court orders outpatient competency evaluation.  FP set for 3/24/16 @ 10am.  Court suggests the competency board placed the deft on house arrest.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk
